intro: Zephyranthes × flaggii, commonly known as the pink rain lily, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to the southern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in sandy, well-drained soils. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white, typically blooming in response to rainfall. It is a perennial herb that often grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and coastal dunes. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes in warm climates.
